alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:00AM EDT until May 02 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Continued flooding caused by last night`s and this morning`s excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Franklin, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Oxford, Sagadahoc, Somerset, Waldo and York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Coos, Grafton, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Even though the heavy rain has ended, streams and creeks continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 AM EDT, Flooding from earlier heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, Rochester, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Portsmouth, Brunswick, Augusta and Westbrook.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
